name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"3f0f8967-9c35-4a21-93fb-649f5928104d","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Group: Value-Flow Tracking (Points)","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"19c7209f-fb89-4fc7-b2cb-b4da870a9fb4","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This group of methods manages the "temporal" state of a definition. In Python, a variable’s meaning can change as the program executes (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"x","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" might point to an Integer at line 5 and a Function at line 10). These functions allow the analysis engine to record these assignments at specific coordinates (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"rows","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") and reconstruct the state of a variable at any point in the code's execution history.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"af8856b7-2143-4b6e-aea1-48fbc83d7232","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"40e19cdf-2363-490c-ac27-d0ae36708000","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Methods","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"594a1ab5-7a0c-4dcd-866a-307dafeb5293","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"add_value_point(row, values)

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Registers a new assignment or value-flow event at a specific line.","styles":{}}],"children":[{"id":"066002ec-1d12-45f9-8ec4-af8dde8e2e95","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It pushes a new ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"PointItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" onto the internal heap to maintain chronological order.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"9ddaf241-88a4-4300-8b74-17f3d6701678","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"If the global ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"precision","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" setting is disabled, it automatically unions these values into the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"bias","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" set, providing a "flat" view of all possible values the definition has ever held.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"04e6107c-6138-472a-acd6-e99d1c668477","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_point(row)

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Retrieves the active state of the definition for a given line number.","styles":{}}],"children":[{"id":"36e4d473-a6c3-42ad-8dfe-edd9593551eb","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It searches through the history and returns the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"PointItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with the highest line number that is still less than or equal to the requested ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"row","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b8f5dd09-8558-4f76-9d93-e548c6d2b121","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This allows the analyzer to answer: ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":""What did this variable point to right before this specific line was executed?"","styles":{"italic":true}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"5895d84c-c059-4c23-a3ce-cc18e71d14b1","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_last_point_value()

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"A convenience method that returns the "current" or final set of potential values for the definition. It combines the values from the very last recorded point with any values stored in the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"bias","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" set to ensure a comprehensive result.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7700197d-385a-46c5-a55c-05dd795f0e06","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"clear_point()

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Wipes the entire value-flow history of the definition. This is typically used during re-analysis phases or when a definition's state needs to be completely reset.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"80f4efd3-6d47-4e60-a6c6-9a6f48180c6e","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"d2a1e3f8-533d-408a-8bae-b76fa8f9cd7d","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Usage Example","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"70058c41-258e-48dc-b886-b62c9d22d6cc","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The analyzer uses these methods to track a variable's evolution through a script.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"38acd837-3f28-45b9-87b3-63d924fe28e1","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"# Analyzing code:
# 10: data = get_raw_string()
# 15: data = parse_json(data)

# Create the definition
data_def = Definition("main.data", "NAME_DEF")

# 1. Record the first assignment at line 10
data_def.add_value_point(10, "STDLIB.str")

# 2. Record the second assignment at line 15
data_def.add_value_point(15, "MOD.JSON_OBJ")

# 3. Lookup state at line 12 (after first assignment, before second)
active_at_12 = data_def.get_point(12)
print(f"Values at line 12: {active_at_12.points_to}") # Output: {'STDLIB.str'}

# 4. Get the final state of the variable
final_values = data_def.get_last_point_value()
print(f"Final state: {final_values}") # Output: {'MOD.JSON_OBJ'}","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"067ce6cb-02f3-46ba-bc1d-f33f1ab5b5c1","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Insights","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"86406c0f-2bb2-4dd2-9a6f-c56c282a35fe","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Precision vs. Performance","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"bias","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" logic allows the system to scale. When high precision is needed, it uses the specific line-indexed ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"points","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". When a fast, global "points-to" set is sufficient, it uses the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"bias","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" union.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"21b4521a-4ac1-4c4a-8224-0221662ab83d","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Heap Efficiency","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": By storing points in a heap-ordered list, ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_point","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" can efficiently find the correct state even if the code was analyzed out of order (e.g., during complex control-flow or cross-file jumps).","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d86af3fe-2043-4674-8bf3-19dc1533440f","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Temporal Integrity","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": This mechanism ensures that if a variable is redefined, the analyzer doesn't accidentally use the "new" value when looking at code that appeared earlier in the file.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"0bb309b8-2c6d-46dd-a22f-3442e026396c","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
